alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:33PM EDT until May 07 at 8:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers... Licking River in Ohio below Newark. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River in Ohio below Newark. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Water is nearly one foot deep on Sleepy Hollow Road, portions of Nathaniel Avenue and Southeast Summit Road. Additionally, water encroaches areas near Caterbury Trails Mobile Home community near Licking View Drive and Forry Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 15.0 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
